channel.title: Mastodon Home Timeline
channel.description: RSS feed for the Mastodon Home timeline

item.title: Albert Cardona
item.description: @Carl_ZimmerThe @eLife assessment for this Fuentes et al. 2023 reviewed preprint succinctly reports the reviewers impressions, ending with:"Unfortunately, the evidence presented in the two related submissions that the current paper entirely relies on is incomplete at this stage."https://elifesciences.org/reviewed-preprints/89125v1

item.title: Caroline Orr Bueno
item.description:
In a middle-of-the-night vote while much of the country was asleep, Iowa Republicans just passed a draconian new law that effectively outlaws abortion in the state. The law bans abortion at 6 weeks ‚Äî before most women know they‚Äôre pregnant. #womensrights #reproductiverights
https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/iowa-republicans-pass-new-6-week-abortion-ban-rcna93625

item.title: Kelly
item.description: I started thinking when I woke up and that's when the trouble started.

item.title: Mats Holberg
item.description: If you need to be delighted by something this morning, I present the tree goats of Morocco.I was driving near Essaouira the first time I saw this and literally slammed on my brakes because I thought I was suddenly hallucinating. But then you learn how common it is and after a day or two it's, oh, yeah, more goats in trees.

item.title: kottke.org
item.description: The whitest paint ever just dropped. "The paint's properties are almost superheroic:" it reflects 98% of sunlight, reduces building surface temperatures by 8¬∞F (up to 19¬∞F at night), and decreases air-conditioning needs by up to 40%. https://www.nytimes.com/2023/07/12/climate/white-paint-climate-cooling.html

item.title: David Schoppik
item.description: Would you believe a 1959 pilot for a proposed #NeroWolfe TV series starring #WilliamShatner as Archie Goodwin? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9_AoebAAig4

item.title: katejjeffery
item.description: Glasgow Psychology/Neuroscience is hiring! Four tenured lectureships in Behavioural Neuroscience (animal x 3 and human x 1) Closing Date: 20th July 2023 Please boost https://www.nature.com/naturecareers/job/12800829/senior-lecturer-lecturer-research-and-teaching-track-4-posts-/

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
Predictions and errors are distinctly represented across V1 layers
https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.07.11.548408Nice results. Very consistent with our study in NHPs. We found that predictions are fed back by beta in deep cortical layers, while prediction errors are fed forward by gamma in superficial layers. Nice to see similar results in HPs.Layer and rhythm specificity for predictive routing
https://doi.org/10.1073/pnas.2014868117

item.title: Ton Roosendaal üî∂
item.description: The Princeton Vision & Learning Lab released a free/open licensed Blender add-on for procedural generation of 3D natural environments. Looks impressive! https://infinigen.org #b3d

item.title: Mike the Mad Biologist
item.description: One More Reason Why We Need Postal Banking https://mikethemadbiologist.com/2023/07/13/one-more-reason-why-we-need-postal-banking/

item.title: Dena Goldblatt
item.description: Crowdsourcing: Does anyone know of #highschool research opportunities in #Myanmar for a student interested in #neuroscience? Def appreciate any leads -- thanks!

item.title: Elizabeth Tasker
item.description: It's 6:30am, I'm in Singapore Airport and Mastodon, do I have a story for YOU.It all began... with an asteroid grain. Again.

item.title: Abandoned America
item.description: The formerly abandoned Bell Labs complex in Holmdel, NJ. After its closure it was successfully repurposed as Bell Works, a multipurpose "urban hub" and served as the set for the popular show "Severance"See it when it was vacant: https://www.abandonedamerica.us/bell-labs

item.title: Sami Case
item.description: Hi there! Finally made the journey over from Twitter. Here‚Äôs an #introduction in hopes of expanding my network on here!My name is Sami and im a neuroscientist. My graduate research helped characterise how S1 neuronal network communication becomes altered with aging, is sexually dimorphic, and how these changes can influence gait.I just started as an assistant professor at Colorado State University, where I teach #neuroscience, phys, and pharm for veterinary medicine/undergrad students. ‚ô•Ô∏è

item.title: SueYeon Chung
item.description:
üéâHappy to share an exciting new theory paper from our group, just published in Physical Review Letters with Editor's suggestionüìñ. Also featuring in Physics Magazine. Congratulations
Albert on this milestone! Title: Linear Classification of Neural Manifolds with Correlated VariabilityPaper: https://journals.aps.org/prl/pdf/10.1103/PhysRevLett.131.027301
Feature in Physics: https://physics.aps.org/articles/v16/108
Arxiv version: https://arxiv.org/pdf/2211.14961.pdf#neuroscience #computationalneuroscience #physics

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/jul/13/florida-fines-voter-registration-groups

item.title: Thesiswhisperer
item.description: Just posted this on the bird site - what is the last straw people need to leave twitter completely? I found my limit. I'm leaving.For me, paying nazi, misogynistic 'influencers' is too far. I've long been passive on Twitter, but used it to distribute content. I can't do it anymore. The values conflict is too much. I'd love it if some academics took a stand with me. I'm going to delete my (50K+) follower account on the 13th of August. I'm staying for a month to do a count down and encourage others to #DeleteTwitter. I don't have a recommendation of where is best to go. Anywhere is better than Twitter and its ocean of hate. Appreciate a boost to build a bit of momentum for this protest attempt

item.title: Marcus Stensmyr
item.description: On Tuesday I will be on TV here in Sweden to talk about mosquitoes. Annual event, and I feel I say the same thing every time‚Ä¶I need new material! Not sure how many of my #mosquito colleagues have made the transfer from Davy Jones locker to here, but any tips and suggestions for some new and noteworthy findings would be greatly appreciated! Please retoot! #aedes #malaria

item.title: Gaspar Jekely
item.description: Our favourite #Platynereis #opsin now in the mammalian brain as a new #optogenetic tool!"Here we ... found that the Platynereis dumerilii ciliary opsin ... is an efficient, versatile, light-activated bistable GPCR that can suppress synaptic transmission in mammalian neurons with high temporal precision in-vivo "https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.07.01.547328v1#neuroscience #GPCR
